headline: Pan-Fried Asparagus
description: Learn how to cook asparagus on the stove by pan-frying it in butter with olive oil and garlic for a flavorsome, family-pleasing vegetable side dish.

video.description: A simple asparagus side dish with garlic, olive oil, and butter.
video.name: Pan-Fried Asparagus

name: Pan-Fried Asparagus

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil, salt, and pepper; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add asparagus and cook until fork-tender, turning asparagus often to ensure even cooking, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Bought it for my husband he loved it! Added a little Parmesan cheese after cooking.
Excellent! Doubled the recipe and made ahead of time. Added the garlic when warming it up so it wouldn't be bitter .
A little olive oil helps the butter not burn during cooking. I used a lower medium heat and they were really good! Firm and green and cooked thru.
Sprinkle some parmesan cheese on it within the last two minutes and it will brown and crumble and add more flavor and a really good crunch with the taste
I added a little more garlic. It was delicious.
So easy, and loved by EVERYONE!!!
Simple and tasty.
Delicious and super quick.
Delicious!!
I've made this recipe 3 times now and I love it. I use a little less salt than it calls for though and it tastes great. I like to make it with salmon.
Awesome, quick, and easy recipe! Mouthwatering, and delicious!
It was ok the garlic turned brown and it made the dish look unappealing
Jane Liked it a lot
This was a first for me and I was 100% pleased with the result; so delicious and easy peasy to prepare.
too much butter, but equal parts of butter and oil.

Really good with the changes suggested by other reviewers. I used about a tablespoon of butter with the 2 TB's of oil and that was more than enough. Despite the warnings, I put the garlic in at the beginning and it did burn brown. Next time, I'll put it in much later or just use garlic powder.

I love asparagus and was looking for a simple recipe that would advise me on how to pan fry it. A little browned, a little buttery, a little garlicky. I like a little Parmesan, too. Four stars simply because the ingredients should call for coarse salt and ground pepper TO TASTE. Someone in comments thought it called for a TABLESPOON of salt. That would be insane. Anyway, I can always count on Allrecipes to get it right. Thank you.
It was delicious and everyone liked it. The only thing I would do different next time is to use about 1/2 tsp kosher salt instead of a whole tsp.
I make this all the time, but I use slightly less butter and oil. Just before it's done, I sprinkle on shredded parmesan cheese and let it melt a bit. This is delicious.
A little salty but I will adjust next time. Delicious!
Came out great!
Excellent

Every time I'm looking for a recipe with Google search, I keep ending up on this website because it usually has recipes I'm looking for so I joined the membership.

I made this asparagus and mushrooms and it was so darn delicious. I had never fried asparagus before. It's the only way I'll do it now. Thank you!

I will be making this over and over. Child 1 had 4 helpings and child 2 had seconds! As they sat at the table plate after plate they discussed what future dishes would go well with this side dish. I was even asked to put more asparagus on my shopping list right away. 
It's a great ''go to'' recipe!!

I didn't have garlic so substituted it with garlic salt, otherwise, it was easy, simple, and delicious.
Will make it again because I get tried of steaming it all the time.
Some of the stalks I had were thinner than they should have been and some got overcooked. Use a "bunch" that are of consistent size and watch how long you fry them.
This is so easy to make and everyone loved it! It is how I make asparagus now.
Excellent and quick
Used only olive oil and cooked to doneness by feel rather than time but essentially this is a fantastic way to get delicious asparagus on a plate.
No changes. Came out awesome. Lots of left over butter so I fried up some potatoes in it, and some tortillas.
Excellent!!
They came out delicious family loves them wife said I missed my calling LOL
This was awful . Way too much oil cooking and way too much salt.
I have never cooked asparagus, but my partner has and loves it. He said that this was the best he ever had! Thanks!
Easy and absolutely delicious!
Delicious! I will start with half the amount of salt then add according to taste.
First time I've made asparagus that my better half likes
Followed recipe as is. Wr make this about every other week!
Definitely will make again!,,
used unsalted butter since i add the salt and then cut that down mmmthen even more if using a salty cheese you did goof
i will make it again, new fam fav
So delicious & very easy to do!
I made this with ravioli during coronavirus quarantine and would definitely make it again.
I used plant butter and definitely will make again!! Awesome!!
This is a wonderful way to prepare Asparagus. I added mushrooms and Onions and decreased the butter.
Quick & easy. Use asparagus before you lose it.
Great dish! Not your traditional asparagus - the family loved it!
I added fresh squeezed lemon juice, while cooking the asparagus in the skillet, so great
Added just a small sprinkle of red pepper flakes before serving.
Wow...that was awesome!!! Thank you!

I held off on adding garlic till half way through cooking of the asparagus. At that same time I also added some soy sauce. A packet from Chinese restaurant is plenty, or about a tablespoon. You could hold off on the added salt if you use packet.
I added mushrooms (quartered) and onions (sliced). Delicious!
My husband and I loved it. I did have minced garlic on hand so I just used garlic powder and it tasted just fine. I will make it again for sure.

loved it! I didn't mind the amounts of butter and olive oil. it was perfect for the bunch of asparagus I bought. I did also add a dash of italian seasoning and a dash of lemon pepper (with less black pepper to start with). That was really good!
I changed the olive oil to coconut oil. And cut down the butter in half. Still tasty.
I made it as listed and it was great. I cooked it a little more as I like my asparagus softer. I will make this again.
I added a tiny bit of Chilli Flakes to spice it up...Thanx to the simple yet a wonderful recipe !!
It was good but a little too salty.

Delicous! Here's a tip: make sure you put the asparagus in butter, not oil. I know the recipe says butter, but some people might put oil as a substitute, and that makes these very unflavorful. But, if you follow the recipe, these will taste amazing! Thanks for the recipe:)

After reading several reviews, I made a few changes. I used about half of the asparagus. First, I sauteed a handful of baby bella mushrooms in a little olive oil and butter for 2 min. Then I added the asparagus (~2" pieces). Sauteed that for about 8 min, for tender-crisp. About 1 minute before it was done, I added two cloves of minced garlic. Nothing worse than burnt garlic, and this would prevent it. Great topped with parmesan cheese, but I also tried with store-bought crisp fried onions.
I added the garlic in the last few minutes of cooking so it wouldn't burn. Will definitely make it again.
This is now my go to recipe for asparagus.
Quick, easy, and great tasting
Less butter and oil is what I'll do next time
We didn't know fresh asparagus could taste so dang great!! Thank you for posting!
Very amazing tasting, quick and easy to make. Did not change a thing.
perfect!

It's great, but don't give in to the olive oil mafia...you can't tell the difference without the olive oil. All the TV cooks try to get you to smother everything in olive oil. Even sometimes in deserts. Fight the olive oil mafia, only use it when you need to!
This was an excellent recipe and so easy to make. I will keep it in my recipe file.
Easy...Added Mushrooms too .
Taste really good and cook it longer or shorter depending on how crinchy you want it
It was delicious, and I certainly will make it again!
Delicious asparagus and only takes about 20 minutes to make. My wife really enjoyed it.
Didn't need quite as much butter and oil -- I cut it down by a third. Otherwise made according to the recipe. Very tasty!
Easy and delicious!!!
Quick and easy!!! Even my child LOVED it and asks for it all the time.
This was wonderful! I did reduce the amount of butter & oil but this will definitely be our recipe of choice for asparagus from here on out.
Absolutely wonderful!!! Our new favorite way to prepare asparagus!
Perfect taste and texture. This is my keeper recipe. So simple. Will make again.
Great recipe except the garlic got burned. Next time will add garlic towards the end where it only cooks for a few minutes. Better flavor than steaming the asparagus..

My husband loved this dish!! I only used half of the amount of butter and oil as suggested by other reviews. I will definitely be making this on a regular but in larger portions so we all can have some since husband ate almost it all by himself
Delicious! I used much less oil and butter, and it was fine. Stir frequently as suggested.
Very good! No changes necessary.

You can't go wrong with this recipe. First I used my fork to eat them, then I was eating them like French fries (I would prefer these over fries any day, don't even need ketchup!). I cooked them for about 8 1/2 - 9 minutes.
Great recipe. I added blue chees sprinkles and a few toasted walnuts on top. Really GOOD!

Super easy and pretty dang delish. A lot of people seemed to be all turned off with the amount of butter listed, but the fact is you don’t have to eat it all. It did help that I had more than a pound in the pan - they were pretty long so I cut them in half and then there seemed to be so much! But I had a lot of butter to move it around in, and in the end a bunch of butter in the pan (I removed to another bowl after cooking ). I didn’t find it too salty and the garlic didn’t burn either - it was quite delicious! I did consider topping off with some red wine, but decided to go with the recipe as written the first time. So glad I did - yum! Will try tweaks some other time. As is, it was a fabulous side to birthday steaks!

This is by far the best asparagus I've ever had. I added mushrooms just because I love them. I'd share a picture but it didn't last long enough on our plates. I did however shared this recipe on Facebook for everyone to try.
 Yum yum!
This was easy and delicious. I will make this again, but next time I may get a little more creative and maybe add a little soy sauce.
Used a little less garlic and liked it very much. Will make it again!
I made this with much less butter and oil and I also added the garlic closer to the end of cooking to prevent it burning. Turned out perfect and delicious. Can't wait to make again.
Normally just steam or grill...I was looking for something different and this was awesome! Added baby portobello mushrooms as well...yum!
I left out the black pepper since I can't eat food with black pepper, but it was still delicious!
Too much butter and olive oil for us. I would use half or less as much next time.
First time, nothing to scream about. Quick, Tasted good. Will try again

I have been making this for years. I don't use olive oil, less butter and use more garlic but we love garlic. I don't add the garlic until the asparagus is almost cooked because it will get over cooked. Also, I use low to med low heat. Once the aspargus is cooked tender crisp, take it off the heat, plate and serve immediately or put in a dish and serve immediately. The hot pan will continue to cook the asparagus and it will get overcooked, Yuk.
Easy and very tasty!
Very good simple recipe. Next time I’ll cook for a little less time.
Very Good!!!! Made as per recipe with no Changes.....Yummy.....
Very yummy! We put it in our shrimp scampi pasta like Olive Garden does
